results.definition: the result of good upbringing (especially knowledge of correct social behavior)
examples: a woman of breeding and refinement
The old master is training world-class violinists
we develop the leaders for the future

results.definition: undergo training or instruction in preparation for a particular role, function, or profession
examples: She is training to be a teacher
He trained as a legal aid

results.definition: develop (children's) behavior by instruction and practice; especially to teach self-control
examples: Parents must discipline their children
Is this dog trained?

results.definition: educate for a future role or function
examples: He is grooming his son to become his successor
The prince was prepared to become King one day
They trained him to be a warrior

results.definition: teach or refine to be discriminative in taste or judgment
examples: Cultivate your musical taste
Train your tastebuds
She is well schooled in poetry

results.definition: point or cause to go (blows, weapons, or objects such as photographic equipment) towards
examples: Please don't aim at your little brother!
He trained his gun on the burglar
Don't train your camera on the women
Take a swipe at one's opponent

results.definition: teach and supervise (someone); act as a trainer or coach (to), as in sports
examples: He is training our Olympic team
She is coaching the crew

results.definition: exercise in order to prepare for an event or competition
examples: She is training for the Olympics

results.definition: cause to grow in a certain way by tying and pruning it
examples: train the vine
They railed from Rome to Venice
She trained to Hamburg

results.definition: drag loosely along a surface; allow to sweep the ground
examples: The toddler was trailing his pants
She trained her long scarf behind her
